sentence.text: A bearish , messianic figure with mutton-chop whiskers , frequently clad in cowboy boots and ` bolo " tie , Asimov was stoically resigned to his own eccentricity .
With an effort she pulled her gaze away from the tall figure clad in blue trousers and black T-shirt .
Car owners needing their wheel or battery changed are now greeted by men clad in bright orange uniforms and natty caps .
A dozen men and women clad in furs were polishing axes and broadswords monotonously , mindlessly .
The third cell ( 82d ) contains a handsome young man clad in ( very dated ) Estalian clothing who suffers an eternal curse on the vanity which Drachenfels now mocks .
Startled , she glanced back to find a man clad in the scarlet overalls and white crash helmet of a driver standing a few yards away .
Her long legs were clad in denims .
Altho' his physiognomy was European , he was clad in the turban and loose trousers of a Malay .
She was clad in a loose robe , as if for night , and her hair was unbraided .
He was clad in the same white coveralls as the half-dozen policemen who had been working over the room , like a coven of wraiths .

Their heads lowered to avoid the outstretched hand and pale features of a thin leather clad figure hunched over in a shop doorway .
It was Lori herself who let her in , clad in a satin robe and nothing else .
Two canons swaggered by from the cathedral , clad in thick woollen robes lined with miniver .
Her target was an excessively tall gangling gentleman , not very suitably clad for the Mediterranean in a suit of gingery wool with the trousers ending in tight bands round the calves .
Peggy Vanderheld , clad in a navy blue form-fitting suit , came into the room .
He was standing in the doorway , his lean frame clad in a loose-fitting tawny-coloured suit that seemed to emphasise the taut muscle that lay beneath it .

Discarding the culotte-shorts , she ran down into the water clad in her olive-green one-piece .
